cd4f6b47-7511-4823-9bf7-e8a16e2df14d.description: The earner of this badge has acquired fundamental knowledge of SMP/E processing for installation and maintenance of systems software and program products. Included within this 4-day course are: an examination of SMP/E commands, a detailed review of MCS statements and their purpose, and exercises to enable the student to gain a working familiarity with SMP/E processing.
cd4f6b47-7511-4823-9bf7-e8a16e2df14d.name: SMP/E Fundamentals

ba98b8c9-6e3a-46cb-a1f8-b8883c7c991b.description: The earner of this badge has learned the essential information needed to make important business decisions, manage internal and external business trends, and identify new business opportunities.
ba98b8c9-6e3a-46cb-a1f8-b8883c7c991b.name: Managing by Metrics

947377f0-1647-477e-9cda-c9b5ff608d3d.description: The earner of this badge completed a 5-day course designed to help programmers, operations staff and managers new to the z/OS environment gain an understanding of MVS concepts, a working knowledge of TSO, ISPF and JCL. The lecture components and hands-on labs together provide the opportunity to understand and use the basic facilities of an MVS environment.
947377f0-1647-477e-9cda-c9b5ff608d3d.name: MVS Skill Pack for z/OS (TSO/ISPF & JCL)

21ec7f38-cc2c-4a08-ad93-7f1508e97964.description: The earner of this Badge has an understanding of all the primary programming constructs in REXX and knows how to meld these constructs into effective REXX programs. They also have knowledge of many advanced techniques.
21ec7f38-cc2c-4a08-ad93-7f1508e97964.name: Comprehensive REXX Programming for z/OS

7795d5d4-c9c3-4f45-9a85-885287c490b0.description: The earner of this badge has learned how to develop a large number of SQL SELECT statements, including joins and subqueries; and knows how to write INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE statements.
7795d5d4-c9c3-4f45-9a85-885287c490b0.name: SQL Basics

7a29532e-9db1-4963-98c1-2bbb35e7dbb3.description: The earner of this badge has completed the initial six weeks of training for the Vitality Residency Program which also includes Broadcom’s own internal ASE program training. During this intensive bootcamp, badge earners acquire skills within the following topics: Intro z/OS, TSO/ISPF, JCL, REXX, COBOL, z/OS Unix Systems Services, Assembler, z/OS subsystems – Database/Transaction Managers, and DFSMS. This bootcamp also included specialized product training.
7a29532e-9db1-4963-98c1-2bbb35e7dbb3.name: z/OS Mainframe Bootcamp

f21f5711-e332-49a1-9801-a72d53a59260.description: The earner of this badge has been provided a general understanding of the UNIX system and taught the basic skills for using it, as well as how UNIX is set up, accessed and used on z/OS. This earner has acquired hands-on practical experience with the basic UNIX facilities on an z/OS operating system.
f21f5711-e332-49a1-9801-a72d53a59260.name: z/OS UNIX Systems Services Introduction

46d7a475-f092-49a0-8554-8b1e9c329eae.description: The earner of this badge has gone through an intense examination of the z/OS for systems programmers. Topics covered include an introduction to computer systems hardware and an exploration of architecture, system services and functions, storage management mechanisms, and I/O processes. Additional topics covered include REXX programming, SMP/E processing, an overview of Workload Manager and performance tuning. Earners also looked and examined at system diagnostics and data collection.
46d7a475-f092-49a0-8554-8b1e9c329eae.name: z/OS Technical Bootcamp

77ddd891-8ac8-46d0-a0da-7949d8682d6f.description: The earner of this badge has examined how CA Endevor SCM manages the software change, plans the software development lifecycle by defining the different stages in the development process, and configures CA Endevor SCM in order to effectively manage the software development lifecycle process. They have the knowledge and skills needed to help an organization successfully plan, implement, and maintain CA Endevor SCM as a software change management tool.
77ddd891-8ac8-46d0-a0da-7949d8682d6f.name: CA Endevor Software Change Manager v18: Administrator 200

35f3bec6-02d2-43f3-a514-2cfd49d06a40.description: This badge earner has the knowledge and skills necessary to begin the process of preparing for the CISSP exam. They have knowledge of the ten domains specified by (ISC)² CISSP CBK.
35f3bec6-02d2-43f3-a514-2cfd49d06a40.name: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)

640b049d-edd7-4e70-942f-0e6a55512f5d.description: The earner of this badge understands the basics of writing and running Python scripts, as well as more advanced features such as file operations, regular expressions, working with binary data, and using the extensive functionality of Python modules.
640b049d-edd7-4e70-942f-0e6a55512f5d.name: Introduction to Python 3.x

b5d92ffa-a218-4c40-965b-764be106621f.description: This badge earner is able to accomplish work using TSO/ISPF in the z/OS environment, including the full screen editor, job submission and monitoring facilities, the utility functions, and productivity features such as command stacking and split screen processing. They are able to code essential JCL statements to submit batch jobs, run some batch utilities and basic SORT work. They have been introduced to procedures and SET, INCLUDE, and JOBLIB statements, among others.
b5d92ffa-a218-4c40-965b-764be106621f.name: ISPF and JCL on z/OS

e4193298-f56a-41f1-b15d-55a9f71192c7.description: The earner of this badge has been acclimated to the IBM mainframe Job Control Language using the z/OS operating system. The earner has been introduced to the MVS JCL language used for production processing.
e4193298-f56a-41f1-b15d-55a9f71192c7.name: MVS JCL Workshop

84e79158-368e-4b31-aa27-5c63bd41ccc5.description: The earner of this badges possesses a comprehensive knowledge and understanding of CA-OPS/MVS and its application and services.
84e79158-368e-4b31-aa27-5c63bd41ccc5.name: OPS/MVS for Vitality

e4b6e0e0-442c-40ae-9dd4-9a099f286c61.description: This badge earner is able to accomplish work using TSO/ISPF in the z/OS environment, including: the full screen editor, job submission and monitoring facilities, the utility functions, and productivity features such as command stacking and split screen processing.
e4b6e0e0-442c-40ae-9dd4-9a099f286c61.name: TSO/ISPF in z/OS

ef0f7606-bf0c-4cdc-871e-5d4cfadc9265.description: provides the skills required to plan and implement Data Facility Storage Management Subsystem. A step-by-step implementation strategy, emphasizing coexistence considerations, is reinforced by hands-on labs. In the hands-on labs, students will be creating constructs as well as coding ACS routines. This milestone approach includes managing temporary and permanent data sets. The course also discusses exploitation of functions provided by DFSMS as the installation evolves to the DFSMS environment.
ef0f7606-bf0c-4cdc-871e-5d4cfadc9265.name: DFSMS Implementation

bd69c8eb-cbd1-4272-809a-d8eea3837ceb.description: The earner of this badge has been taught the debugging skills that are necessary to effectively solve problems that affect CICS/TS' normal execution.
bd69c8eb-cbd1-4272-809a-d8eea3837ceb.name: CICS/TS Structure & Problem Analysis

3b176e7e-6e0f-4e6f-bc26-d2c3c5d40fce.description: The earner of this badge is able to develop and test ISPF Dialogs on MVS under TSO using the REXX programming language.
3b176e7e-6e0f-4e6f-bc26-d2c3c5d40fce.name: ISPF Dialog Development

e745dc53-5e8b-42e2-9611-b3fb74bde9b3.description: The earner of this badge has undergone an examination of z/OS for systems programmers, operators and application programmers. They have acquired an introduction to the System Z systems hardware and an exploration of z/OS architecture, system services and functions, storage management mechanisms and I/O processes. The earner has knowledge of how to explore the operation of the z/OS environment with an objective of understanding its performance and exploitation opportunities.
e745dc53-5e8b-42e2-9611-b3fb74bde9b3.name: z/OS Fundamentals

00c4dd18-228d-42d3-9712-b7e3c125d732.description: This badge earner completed a course designed to help intermediate-advanced system programmers, operators, and application programmers use and code JCL procedures effectively, including analyzing condition codes and system error messages that provide clues to the cause of JCL and utility control statement errors. They understand effective procedure coding techniques such as use of symbolic parameters, DDNAME operands, and other coding techniques to streamline the required JCL.
00c4dd18-228d-42d3-9712-b7e3c125d732.name: Advanced MVS JCL and Utilities

8ae6aad4-c9cd-4fda-8618-d5ceedc1270e.description: The earner of this badge has been introduced to the management of modern IT-enabled services, is able to understand the common language and key concepts, and can demonstrate how organizations and work can improve with the ITIL 4 guidance. The earner understands the ITIL 4 service management framework and how it has evolved to adopt modern technologies and ways of working.
8ae6aad4-c9cd-4fda-8618-d5ceedc1270e.name: ITIL 4 Foundation Certificate Program

6cfa7b57-f2dc-4ada-8a81-41b5138f1d69.description: The earner of this badge is familiar with the new programming language from Microsoft and its features such as dynamic data types, named and optional arguments, tuples, asynchronous programming keywords, nullable reference types, and immutable record types. The earner has been introduced to object-oriented thinking and features, such as classes, inheritance, and polymorphism, properties, indexers, delegates, events, and interfaces.

4c0343b2-bd69-4605-9424-a0c29bfd9e5e.description: This earner understands core project management concepts and techniques. Their exposure extends to PMBOK concepts with supplemental, field-proven best practices that are designed to overcome common sources of project failure. They know how to write a convincing project charter, establish project control through careful scope definition and management, develop a comprehensive schedule and budget, report project status, minimize issues through proactive risk management, control costs and more.
4c0343b2-bd69-4605-9424-a0c29bfd9e5e.name: Project Management Fundamentals

367ff9e6-d17e-4f7c-82b3-84a796a4cad2.description: The earner of this badge can maintain, install, service and configure a z/VM system.
367ff9e6-d17e-4f7c-82b3-84a796a4cad2.name: z/VM Systems Programming Workshop

abea0158-297c-48e6-8290-4dff2d06d85b.description: The earner of this badge has built on their existing user-level knowledge and experience with personal computer operating systems and networks to present the fundamental skills and concepts needed to use on the job in any type of networking career. The earner has taken the first step to take before preparing for the CompTIA Network+ examination.
abea0158-297c-48e6-8290-4dff2d06d85b.name: CompTIA Network+

af4fc561-81ac-4bcb-bdce-6ac264f58e02.description: course prepares you to implement and manage DFSMShsm. You will learn how to automate the storage management tasks, which optimize DASD space utilization and provide data availability. You will be taught basic DFSMShsm terminology and concepts, and you will examine the functions and interfaces used to tailor DFSMShsm processing to meet your installation's storage management requirements. Hands-on lab exercises enable you to perform a step-by-step implementation.
af4fc561-81ac-4bcb-bdce-6ac264f58e02.name: DFSMShsm Implementation

a7b4529e-c5d8-4c41-b635-efdfc2fb166c.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed a challenging course that focuses on the fundamental tools and concepts of Linux and Unix. 24deda93-d1ac-455c-8ead-7350f0dc08bd.description: The earner of this badge is able to write or maintain COBOL programs that do not require advanced capabilities of the language. The emphasis here is learning the basics of the language, along with developing program design skills using pseudocode.
24deda93-d1ac-455c-8ead-7350f0dc08bd.name: Structured COBOL Workshop for Enterprise COBOL

c6b5a383-ac11-4eb0-a5de-91a8a2da4f2e.description: The earner of this badge has explored the operation of the z/OS environment with and understands its performance and exploitation opportunities.

04a36448-f750-488f-bf93-250d825b6825.description: The earner of this badge understands how to use RACF command parameters and panels to define users and groups, protect general resources, z/OS data sets, and choose a basic set of RACF options.

878d0062-2760-41bc-913f-a328fbb345be.description: The earner of this badge understands how a CICS system is put together and can identify CICS-managed resources, describe system utilities, and discuss storage management, communications, and program interfaces.

fa720d3d-7bc7-455f-af0e-9c6c30ba02de.description: The earner of this badge possesses essential communication skills and strategies necessary for managing business relationships in today's fast-paced, demanding IT environment.

581a1b40-9e13-4a31-b749-5cfc2eb75c66.description: The earner of this badge has learned practical and essential conflict management and resolution skills and gained experience and confidence in applying the skills essential to managing and resolving conflict.

bee36a15-5501-40dd-abb7-0c486de77c69.description: The earner of this badge can use Hardware Configuration and Definition (HCD) to plan and initiate dynamic reconfiguration of zSeries hardware environments. The earner is capable of creating and dynamically altering an Input/Output (I/O) configuration and understands I/O Configuration Datasets.

1c85ca08-df63-43ed-91d8-ce031ce40520.description: This earner has been introduced to the fundamental concepts behind Angular. They understand the fundamentals of creating custom components and the architecture and layout of Angular projects. They understand the basics of Angular project structure and design decisions.
1c85ca08-df63-43ed-91d8-ce031ce40520.name: In-Depth Introduction to Angular and NgRx (2/4/5/6/7/9)

8b14cfec-337b-4be3-9aef-fa8b26e1e61f.description: The earner of this badge has an understanding of ANSI/ISO standard SQL, with examples in SQL Server, Oracle, DB2 LUW and z/OS, and MySQL, with an emphasis on SQL Server and Oracle.

8a1242ad-ce7f-49ae-a772-accf28ddca6a.description: The earner of this badge is able to assess the security posture of an enterprise environment and recommend and implement appropriate security solutions through monitoring and securing environments.
8a1242ad-ce7f-49ae-a772-accf28ddca6a.name: The Official CompTIA Security+ (Exam SY0-601)

71af0a3d-3af1-44c0-866d-d7f8b1d37a8c.description: The earner of this badge has learned basic operation of the IT network environment and can recognize and identify the current security threats it faces.
71af0a3d-3af1-44c0-866d-d7f8b1d37a8c.name: Understanding & Identifying IT Security Threats

c11fd4ee-8ece-4f89-baf5-0740c499ecfc.description: This badge earner has been introduced to the concepts of VSAM. They have learned in detail how to use VSAM data sets and catalogs. They also have knowledge on how to create and maintain files, and suggested ways to optimize performance and to provide data security and integrity.
c11fd4ee-8ece-4f89-baf5-0740c499ecfc.name: VSAM with Access Method Services

8b740710-4340-44cb-aea2-7c992b33e338.description: The earner of this Badge has received proactive, introductory coverage of the knowledge and skills essential to business analysts today (and into the foreseeable future). These earners have had the opportunity to use many of the techniques discussed in class.

During this course, badge earners acquired skills in I/O processing, conditional testing, arithmetic operations, table handling, subprogram concepts and linkage conventions. The course also covered structured programming using the new COBOL for MVS constructs for Do groups (inline performs), Dowhile, Dountil, Selection (IF THEN ELSE) and Case (evaluate). This training is current to the latest release of Enterprise COBOL.

cd2d9d29-ec6b-4c55-b91b-1e0cbffe5376.name: Introduction to z/OS

0bf55b0d-76bc-4255-80a0-f188b8c9a1cb.description: The earner of this badge has learned to achieve organizational goals through motivating others and maximizing their team's skills and potential without having direct authority. 9b411ac2-e522-4b68-84da-22f4afb0608e.description: The earner of this badge has a comprehensive understanding of z/OS architecture, system services and functions, storage management mechanisms, and I/O processes.

A series of written and lab exercises were used to reinforce the classroom education. Earners have the knowledge to code, assemble, and execute a series of programs using fixed point and decimal instructions with instructor supplied JCL and test data.
253eec89-ad5a-4ab8-b451-016de4e8c3c3.name: Basic Assembler Language

They understand how CA ACF2 provides protection by default, as well as about control databases and how to write, compile, decompile, and test CA ACF2 access rules for data sets.
3692c984-3d25-4740-a3d8-40cbc144351d.name: CA ACF2 for z/OS Version 16.x: Foundations 200

16cd5e5e-7256-4acb-b877-ac4eee1bbcdd.description: The earner of this badge has a comprehensive understanding of the recovery environment and procedures, with emphasis on Work Recovery, Current and prior point in time recovery, failure analysis, recovery from media failures, as well as building and implementing Db2 Recovery related procedures.

5e1ffeb6-99f5-49df-ba1b-d7f5b5685dfc.name: Fundamentals of Test Automation

Emphasis is placed on teaching the skills required in normal day-to-day administration tasks, backup and recovery, system configuration and maintenance. Security concepts and User Setup is also detailed as is auditing capabilities.

c3a3121a-43e5-4899-80ac-cc37551a5176.description: The earner of the badge possesses and introductory knowledge of Assembler Language programming, including computer architecture, reviewing instruction formats, and basic assembler language instructions.
c3a3121a-43e5-4899-80ac-cc37551a5176.name: Introduction to Assembler Language

2f827464-6be3-4e5b-a068-78e51d497c21.description: This badge earner has had an introduction to the IBM i (iSeries, AS/400) for programmers and other technical staff that need to understand the technical capabilities of the IBM i. They know how to use the IBM Websphere Application Development Studio Toolset including PDM, SEU, and SDA.
2f827464-6be3-4e5b-a068-78e51d497c21.name: Introduction to Programming Concepts and Facilities for IBM i (iSeries, AS/400)

The earner has critical skills, insights and self-awareness to more effectively guide decision-making.
88d10d3c-af97-478c-8a6d-0af537c3504f.name: Managing Your Career for Short and Long Term

b0d63235-306c-496d-aa34-5d3934a43fe1.description: The earner of this badge has developed core leadership skills and behaviors essential to advancing in a leadership position. The earner has explored and discussed essential leadership concepts and behaviors together with how to apply these concepts and behaviors apply to specific situations.
b0d63235-306c-496d-aa34-5d3934a43fe1.name: Masterful Leadership & Motivation for IT Professionals

c040ddf6-d45f-49b7-9799-77637d592add.description: This badge earner has examined core agile BA concepts, and has engaged in hands-on exercises in order to learn commonly used tools and techniques.

c98e409e-b229-4a7b-8397-6aae1c4d4eaf.name: BRM Fundamentals

0bf014bc-e115-4f6b-be2d-b4deeac512af.description: The earner of this badge understands comprehensive security for the z/OS, z/VM and z/VSE environments—including z/OS UNIX and Linux for zSeries. The earner is able to simplify the management of users and their access rights with built-in, comprehensive administrative and reporting tools, along with detailed event logging capabilities.. Finally, the earner is able to write CA Top Secret commands to configure the tools and generate reports.
0bf014bc-e115-4f6b-be2d-b4deeac512af.name: CA Top Secret for z/OS v16: Security Mainframe and Distributed Integrations 200

5ec4c494-3720-4d35-9907-887be4fa4c97.description: The earner of this badge can effectively & efficiently design, create & maintain Db2 databases using Db2 for z/OS; use Entity Relationship Modeling techniques to design & normalize a relational database, and demonstrate how to define Db2 objects, including Databases, Storage Groups, Tablespaces, Tables, including temporal tables, Indexes, Views, Aliases, Materialized Query Tables & Clone Tables. 851cdb56-7d10-4b74-a909-694ed9c450c5.description: The earner of this badge has learned how to effectively deal with difficult people by distinguishing between various types of difficult behavior and choose successful responses to avoid conflict escalation.
